VPC plot using ggplot2 (Xpose-alike version)

ggvpc_xpose.Rd

Plot basic vpc with 95% CI of 2.5th, 50th & 97.5th predicted percentile and observed data. This call is to be extended with for stratification, and axes definition using the layering custom to ggplot2 objects. See the examples below to learn more.

ggvpc_xpose(vpc, PI = c(0.025, 0.975),
  area.col.central = PI.ci.med.arcol, area.col.outer = gray(0.2),
  linecol.pred = "blue", linesize.pred = 1, linetype.obs = "dashed",
  linecol.obs = "black", linesize.obs = 0.5, alpha = 0.33,
  point.shape = 1, point.size = 1.25, point.col = "darkslategrey",
  yrange.stretch = c(0.9, 1.1), quiet = TRUE)

Arguments

vpc

output from nm.read.vpc
PI

prediction interval (c(0.025,0.975) for 95% CI)
area.col.central

color of prediction polygon for the central tendency
area.col.outer

color of prediction polygon for the outer percentiles
linecol.pred

color of predicted lines
linesize.pred

line width of of predicted lines
linetype.obs

line type of predicted lines
linecol.obs

line color of observed data
linesize.obs

line width of observed data
alpha

transparancy scalar (between 0 and 1)
point.shape

numeric value for dot shape
point.size

scalar of the observed data dot size
point.col

color of observed data dots
yrange.stretch

vector of c(min,max) which will proportionally rescale the lower and upper limits of the Y axis

Value

A ggplot object to be extended optionally

Note

Editing and stratification to be done by adding ggplot layer

See also

nm.read.vpc, ggvpc_standard

Examples

## example of vpc NOT involving stratification
 nm.read.vpc(path =  file.path(getOption("qpExampleDir"),"vpc_final_strt")) -> vpc.all
#> /home/travis/build/qPharmetra/qpToolkit/NONMEM/vpc_final_strt/vpc_results.csv was not found for reading
#> Warning: cannot open file '/home/travis/build/qPharmetra/qpToolkit/NONMEM/vpc_final_strt/NA': No such file or directory
#> Error in file(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection

ggvpc_xpose(vpc.all) +
  labs(x="Time (h)", y="Concentration (ng/ml)")
#> Error in names(vpc$obs)[names(vpc$obs) == unique(vpc$obs$idv.var)] = "IVAR": object 'vpc.all' not found

ggvpc_xpose(vpc.all) +
  labs(x="Time (h)", y="Concentration (ng/ml)") +
  scale_y_log10() + scale_x_log10()
#> Error in ggvpc_xpose(vpc.all): object 'vpc.all' not found

## demonstration of changing colors & stratification
ggvpc_xpose(vpc.all
            , area.col.outer = qp.green
            , area.col.central = qp.blue
            , linecol.pred = steel
            , alpha = 1
            , linesize.pred=3
            , PI = c(0.05,0.95)) +
  labs(x="Time (h)", y="Concentration (ng/ml)") +
  scale_y_log10() + scale_x_log10() + facet_grid(~strata)
#> Error in ggvpc_xpose(vpc.all, area.col.outer = qp.green, area.col.central = qp.blue,     linecol.pred = steel, alpha = 1, linesize.pred = 3, PI = c(0.05,         0.95)): object 'vpc.all' not found

## PI smoothed
nm.read.vpc(path =  file.path(getOption("qpExampleDir"),"vpc_final_strt"),PI.ci.area.smooth=TRUE) -> vpc.all
#> /home/travis/build/qPharmetra/qpToolkit/NONMEM/vpc_final_strt/vpc_results.csv was not found for reading
#> Warning: cannot open file '/home/travis/build/qPharmetra/qpToolkit/NONMEM/vpc_final_strt/NA': No such file or directory
#> Error in file(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection
ggvpc_xpose(vpc.all
            , PI = c(0.05,0.95)) +
  labs(x="Time (h)", y="Concentration (ng/ml)") +
  scale_y_log10() + scale_x_log10() + facet_grid(~strata)
#> Error in ggvpc_xpose(vpc.all, PI = c(0.05, 0.95)): object 'vpc.all' not found
